comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo connected with the Salvation Army's 1913 Christmas Dinner campaign in New York City:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4669375278/]

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: The people in this photo seem rather well-to-do, to be getting a dinner from the Salvation Army.  Maybe they're delivering?

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: I think you may be right. I also wonder about that grim fortress in the background. Could it be a prison? Or perhaps an armory? (I don't know NYC.)

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content:
I think that's the old 244th Coast Artillery Armory, which according to nysonglines.com was "oppressive" and located at 125 14th St. , next door to what was then the 14th St. Theater (on the right in the photo) -- it used to be the Lyceum Theater.  Both buildings were demolished, and the McBurney YMCA is now on the old Armory site.

The Salvation Army headquarters is and was just down the street.

(The internet is like magic sometimes.)

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Thanks, rjones. You're a fast operator!
